channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: VP Vance tries to progress Gaza ceasefire. And, White House demolition draws critics
item.description: Vice President JD Vance is in Israel to address challenges in the Gaza ceasefire. And, the demolition of the East Wing of the White House has drawn criticism and raised questions about ethics.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President JD Vance is in Israel to address challenges in the Gaza ceasefire. And, the demolition of the East Wing of the White House has drawn criticism and raised questions about ethics.

(Image credit: Fadel Senna)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Mental exercise can reverse a brain change linked to aging, study finds
item.description: Scientists have found the first compelling evidence that cognitive training can boost levels of a brain chemical that typically declines as people age.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists have found the first compelling evidence that cognitive training can boost levels of a brain chemical that typically declines as people age.

(Image credit: adventtr/iStockphoto)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: The federal government is still shut down. Here's what that means across the country
item.description: The federal government remains shut down. The NPR Network is following the ways the shutdown is affecting services across the country.
item.content:encoded:
The federal government remains shut down. The NPR Network is following the ways the shutdown is affecting services across the country.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: The NPR Network

item.title: Mamdani's rise in NYC reflects generational fight within the Democratic Party
item.description: Newcomer Zohran Mamdani, age 34, has used social media and big progressive ideas to shoulder past Andrew Cuomo, who's 67 and long a member of Democratic Party royalty.
item.content:encoded:
Newcomer Zohran Mamdani, age 34, has used social media and big progressive ideas to shoulder past Andrew Cuomo, who's 67 and long a member of Democratic Party royalty.

(Image credit: Angelina Katsanis)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Trump uses 'common sense' to make a political point. It has populist appeal
item.description: The phrase appeals more to several demographics that strongly align with Trump, says Republican strategist Frank Luntz, including older voters, for whom he suggests it signals "a more simple past."
item.content:encoded:
The phrase appeals more to several demographics that strongly align with Trump, says Republican strategist Frank Luntz, including older voters, for whom he suggests it signals "a more simple past."

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch and Joe Griffin/Hulton Archive)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Spanish league cancels plans for Barcelona to play regular-season match in Miami
item.description: The Spanish soccer league said Tuesday that plans for Barcelona to play a game against Villarreal outside Miami in December have been called off, following increased opposition to the match.
item.content:encoded:
The Spanish soccer league said Tuesday that plans for Barcelona to play a game against Villarreal outside Miami in December have been called off, following increased opposition to the match.

(Image credit: Joan Monfort)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump pick to lead watchdog agency withdraws after offensive text messages revealed
item.description: President Trump's pick to lead a federal watchdog agency withdrew from consideration Tuesday evening after his offensive text messages were made public and GOP senators revolted.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's pick to lead a federal watchdog agency withdrew from consideration Tuesday evening after his offensive text messages were made public and GOP senators revolted.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Republicans advance the mid-decade redistricting fight into swing-state North Carolina
item.description: North Carolina is poised to become the first swing state to draw new congressional districts amid a nationwide redistricting battle initiated by President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
North Carolina is poised to become the first swing state to draw new congressional districts amid a nationwide redistricting battle initiated by President Trump.

(Image credit: Chris Seward)
item.dc:creator: Adam Wagner

item.title: Pardoned Capitol rioter arrested for allegedly threatening to kill Hakeem Jeffries
item.description: New York State Police say the man was arrested after they received word from the FBI that that he made "threats to kill a member of Congress."
item.content:encoded:
New York State Police say the man was arrested after they received word from the FBI that that he made "threats to kill a member of Congress."

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Reversing peanut advice prevented tens of thousands of allergy cases, researchers say
item.description: A decade ago, research said giving young children peanut products can prevent allergies. A new study says that, 10 years later, tens of thousands of U.S. children have avoided allergies as a result.
item.content:encoded:
A decade ago, research said giving young children peanut products can prevent allergies. A new study says that, 10 years later, tens of thousands of U.S. children have avoided allergies as a result.

(Image credit: Patrick Sison)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell
